articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Sohae Space Center to Congratulate Scientists, Technicians
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Sohae Space Center to Congratulate Scientists, Technicians
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission visited the Sohae Space Center located in Cholsan County, North Phyongan Province to congratulate scientists and technicians on their great contribution to the successful launch of the second version of the satellite Kwangmyongsong-3.
					 He, who is also supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, arrived there at dawn by making a long trip along a snow-covered road.
					
					 He highly praised the scientists and technicians for having performed feats in successfully putting the satellite into orbit by carrier rocket Unha-3, true to the last instructions of leader Kim Jong Il, and had a photo session with them.
					
					 Then he dropped in at the General Satellite Launch Command Center to watch again a video showing the process of the satellite launch.
					
					 Noting that the scientists and technicians of the DPRK successfully implemented the last instruction of Kim Jong Il to lift off a scientific and technological satellite in 2012 which marks the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung at a time when the whole country is pervaded with boundless yearning and reverence for Kim Jong Il, he expressed thanks to them in the name of the WPK Central Committee.
					
					 The successful launch of the satellite is a striking demonstration of the general national power of the DPRK, he noted, inviting the scientists and technicians who have made a great contribution to powerfully demonstrating the scientific and technological might of Juche Korea before the whole world, to visit Pyongyang.
					
					 He told them to come to Pyongyang and visit together with him Kim Jong Il who lies in state at the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to make a report to him on the successful launch of the satellite.
					
					 He said that the successful launch of the satellite once again demonstrated before the whole world the will of the DPRK to unconditionally carry out what the WPK decides to do.
					
					 The successful satellite launch is a shining victory of the WPK's policy on science and technology and its idea of pushing back the frontiers of latest science and technology, he stressed, adding that it is necessary to continue holding fast to the policy of giving importance to science and technology in future, too, and this is a consistent line of the WPK. 
					
					 Pointing out that it is the age of science and technology, he underscored the need for the whole party and state to establish traits of attaching importance to science and technology and not to spare investment in developing them.
					
					 He expressed great expectation and conviction that the scientists and technicians at the space center would bring about a fresh turn in space scientific research and satellite launch on the basis of the latest successful liftoff.

articles.title: Pyongyang Army-People Rally Hails Successful Satellite Launch
articles.content:
Pyongyang Army-People Rally Hails Successful Satellite Launch
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A Pyongyang army-people rally was held at Kim Il Sung Square Friday to hail the successful launch of the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3.
					 Present at the rally were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae and other leading officials of the party, state and army, officials of party, armed forces and power bodies, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and men of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces. Officials and working people of institutions, factories and enterprises at all levels and co-operative farms and teachers and students of universities and colleges in Pyongyang, overseas Koreans' delegations and other overseas Koreans and the chief of the Pyongyang Mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front were also present.
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of foreign countries here, members of the military attache corps here and other foreign guests.
					
					 Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, made a report at the rally. 
					
					 He said:
					
					 The scientific and technological satellite, belonging to Songun Korea both in name and reality, was accurately put into its orbit by carrier rocket Unha-3 which was manufactured by the DPRK with its own technology and by its own efforts in line with the government's policy for space development and its peaceful use. This is a gift presented to leader Kim Jong Il by the WPK and the army and people of the DPRK out of their loyalty and a great jubilee of national significance in realizing the greatest desire at the behest of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, blazing a trail of history, laid a firm foundation of eternal value for the independent national economy and helped fully tap the potentials of Juche-based industry with the might of Songun. Therefore, the DPRK has become possible to demonstrate its might as a country that produces and launches satellites.
					
					 A working satellite was successfully launched thanks to the undying feats of the Generalissimos, and Songun Korea ranked itself with dignity among those countries which launched satellites. The credit for this goes to the lofty loyalty, strong sense of moral obligation, matchless grit and superb stratagem of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 With the successful launch of the satellite as a momentum the might of Juche-based industry and the scientific and technological potentials of the country have been fully displayed and the might of the DPRK heading toward the world with pride have been fully proved.
					
					 To develop and use satellites essential for economic development is the lawful requirement of the present times in which one develops and lives with the help of science and technology. It is also the worldwide trend and the just sovereign right of the Korean people no one can deny.
					
					 Then speeches were made by representatives of scientists, service personnel, workers, agricultural workers, youth and students.
					
					 Jang Chol, president of the State Academy of Sciences, vowed to glorify the country as a world space power by launching a geostationary satellite in the future, and build a knowledge-based economic power of Korean style with the same spirit and creating trait displayed by the workers at the Huichon Ryonha General Machine Plant.
					
					 No Kwang Chol, deputy chief of the General Staff of the KPA, declared that if the U.S. imperialists and their followers encroach upon the dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK even a bit while taking issue with the independent satellite launch, the KPA will regard it as the declaration of a war and resolutely shatter it with powerful physical strike.
					
					 Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, pledged to lead the thunder of the launch of the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 to the fireworks for the final victory in building a thriving socialist nation by stirring up the hot wind of Kim Jong Il's patriotism in each worksite of the general offensive for implementing the WPK's strategy for prosperity.
					
					 Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, expressed the will to drastically increase the agricultural production by learning from the patriotic devotion and tremendous fighting traits of scientists and technicians who gave full play to the dignity and stamina of the nation by successfully launching the satellite.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, called upon young people to bring about leaping progress in most difficult and toilsome worksites of socialist construction and become heroes and scientists who push back the frontiers of the latest science and technology and thus further glorify today's jubilee.

articles.title: Pyongyang Army-People Rally Hails Successful Satellite Launch
articles.content:
Pyongyang Army-People Rally Hails Successful Satellite Launch
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A Pyongyang army-people rally was held at Kim Il Sung Square Friday to hail the successful launch of the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3.
					 Present at the meeting were senior officials of the party, state and army, officials of party, armed forces and power bodies, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, merited scientists and technicians and officers and men of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces. Officials and working people of institutions, factories and enterprises at all levels and co-operative farms and teachers and students of universities and colleges in Pyongyang also attended.
					
					 A report was made at the rally to be followed by speeches of representatives of people of different social standings.
					
					 They said that the satellite which was manufactured by the DPRK with its own technology and efforts was accurately put into its orbit in line with the government's policy for space development and its peaceful use, adding that this is a gift of loyalty presented to leader Kim Jong Il by the party, army and people of the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK has a firm hold on a key to conquering the space which represents the combination of ultra-modern science and technology, they said, stressing that it is a precious fruition of the brilliant far-sightedness and outstanding leadership provided by the peerlessly great men.
					
					 The scientists and technicians who put the country's technology for the peaceful use of space on a new, higher stage and demonstrated the inexhaustible might of Songun Korea are genuine patriots and treasures in building a thriving nation, they said.
					
					 No force on earth can check the independent decision of Songun Korea based on the powerful military guarantee, they stressed.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK who are dynamically advancing toward the just cause after possessing nuclear deterrent, carrier rocket and working satellite will build a powerful and prosperous socialist country in reunified land in the foreseeable future, they added.
					
					 They pledged to become heroes who devotedly carry out the leader's instructions and perform feats in building a thriving nation in the same spirit with which scientists and technicians successfully launched the satellite.

articles.title: Pyongyang Army-People Rally Hails Successful Satellite Launch
articles.content:
Pyongyang Army-People Rally Hails Successful Satellite Launch
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A Pyongyang army-people rally is now under way at Kim Il Sung Square to hail the successful launch of the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3.
					 It is attended by many service personnel and people from all walks of life who gathered in the square and the plaza of the Tower of the Juche Idea opposite to it to celebrate the great auspicious event in the nation's history spanning 5 000 years, the event which demonstrated the overall national power of Songun Korea.

articles.title: Satellite Liftoff Displays Development of DPRK's Science
articles.content:
Satellite Liftoff Displays Development of DPRK's Science
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea successfully launched the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 with carrier rocket Unha-3 on Wednesday.
					 This satellite is for collecting information and data needed for study of space and earth observation.
					
					 As a great national event, its successful liftoff represented the DPRK's overall national strength.
					
					 Space development and peaceful use have become a world trend, but it is a small number of countries that are able to manufacture, launch and operate satellites by themselves.
					
					 The DPRK manufactured the satellite entirely with its own technologies and efforts and succeeded in putting it into a desired orbit, thus displaying again the might of its developing ultramodern science.
					
					 Now the DPRK people are very grateful to leader Kim Jong Il, who had made tireless efforts for the development of the nation's science in his lifetime, giving priority to science as well as to ideology and military affairs.

articles.title: Credit for Successful Satellite Launch Goes to Kim Jong Un: Scientist
articles.content:
Credit for Successful Satellite Launch Goes to Kim Jong Un: Scientist
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea successfully launched the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 on Dec. 12, delighting all the people of the country.
					 In this regard, KCNA met a space scientist.
					
					 He said:
					
					 The credit for the successful satellite launch goes to the wise guidance of respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He gave strength and courage to the scientists, saying that the launch would be successful. He personally set a date and time suitable to the launch and gave a final written order regarding the launch to the Korean Committee of Space Technology at 8 a.m. Wednesday.
					
					 About one hour ahead of the launch, he went to the General Satellite Control and Command Center to acquaint himself with the preparations for the launch, and ordered the satellite launch.
					
					 Through the course of its launch, we, space scientists, came to feel again that Kim Jong Un is a peerlessly great man identical to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and that he is a master of science and a great teacher.
					
					 As he instructed, we will bring a fresh progress in the research into space science and launch of other satellites on the basis of the recent success.

articles.title: Satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 Will Be Helpful to Progress of National Economy: Educationists
articles.content:
Satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 Will Be Helpful to Progress of National Economy: Educationists
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea launched the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 on Wednesday.
					 As an earth observation satellite, it will be greatly helpful to developing the nation's economy, Kim Won Guk, head of a department of Kim Il Sung University, told KCNA.
					
					 He further said:
					
					 "The satellite will serve as a foundation to drastically raise the accuracy of weather forecast.
					
					 To ensure accuracy of weather forecast, there should be correct information beforehand. The satellite makes it possible for the DPRK to gain information on temperatures of sea and land surfaces and atmosphere, humidity and wind and other meteorological data. Such information will help prevent or reduce natural disasters."
					
					 Son Tong Hyok, a teacher of the university, said:
					
					 "The second version of Kwangmyongsong-3 is an earth observation satellite urgently needed for survey of natural resources in the country.
					
					 This satellite going along the sun-synchronous orbit will be of great help to map making, agricultural development and surveys of forests, seas, geology and natural disasters."

articles.title: Any Country Has Right to Use Outer Space: Pyongyang Citizens
articles.content:
Any Country Has Right to Use Outer Space: Pyongyang Citizens
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea successfully launched the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 on Wednesday.
					 However, some countries have criticized it as a "violation of UN resolutions" or a test launch of long-range missile.
					
					 In this regard, KCNA had interviews with citizens in Pyongyang.
					
					 Kim Jung Song, 36, a citizen living in Central District said:
					
					 "As recognized by international law, the right to use the outer space for peaceful purpose rests with any country.
					
					 Not a few countries have made sustained efforts to conquer the space like the DPRK.
					
					 But some countries persistently term the DPRK's satellite launch a 'long-range missile' launch. Such hostile act will only escalate confrontation and render the situation acute."
					
					 Jong Min, 55, another citizen living in Moranbong District, said:
					
					 "Those countries calling the DPRK's satellite launch a 'violation of UN resolutions' have already launched a number of satellites.
					
					 An attempt to deter other country's development will be of no help to anyone. It is necessary to see all issues from the peaceful point of view and in a fair way."

articles.title: Successful Satellite Launch Makes Korean People Sorely Miss Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Successful Satellite Launch Makes Korean People Sorely Miss Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- With the successful launch of the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3, all the people in the DPRK are now very grateful to leader Kim Jong Il for having turned the country into a full-fledged satellite manufacturing and launching state.
					 In this regard, KCNA had interviews with people watching the launch-related videos on the large-sized electronic display at  Pyongyang Railway Station.
					
					 Ri Sun Yong, a citizen living in Rason City, said:
					
					 "I am very pleased to hear the news about the successful satellite liftoff.
					
					 The news made me sorely miss Kim Jong Il, who had made tireless efforts to bring this great national event to the people."
					
					 Kim Tong Chol, another citizen living in Pyongsong City, South Phyongan Province, said:
					
					 "The successful launch represents the DPRK's inexhaustible strength which was attained by General Kim Jong Il with his Songun (military-first) politics.
					
					 Thanks to his patriotic devotion, the nation's dignity has risen to a higher level."
					
					 The satellite launch has pushed servicepersons and civilians across the country into ardent yearning for Kim Jong Il, who dedicated all his life to the building of a prosperous and powerful nation.

articles.title: DPRK's Successful Satellite Launch Hailed by Deputy Head of Joint Chiefs of Iranian Army
articles.content:
DPRK's Successful Satellite Launch Hailed by Deputy Head of Joint Chiefs of Iranian Army
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Masoud Jazayeri, deputy head of the Joint Chiefs of Staff of the Iranian Army, on Wednesday warmly congratulated the government and people of the DPRK on their successful launch of the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3.
					 History shows that if independent countries make persistent efforts, standing unfazed by anyone's influence, they can rapidly advance toward the road of progress and independence in the field of science and technology with self-confidence, he said.
					
					 "Hegemonic states like the United States are incapable of blocking the progress of independent states," he said.

articles.title: Russians Hail DPRK's Successful Satellite Launch
articles.content:
Russians Hail DPRK's Successful Satellite Launch
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Figures of various circles and other people of Russia sincerely congratulate the DPRK on its latest space scientific and technological success, its successful launch of the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3.
					 Aleksandr Chetberikov, deputy to the State Duma of Russia, congratulated the DPRK on its successful launch of the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 for peaceful purposes. This is a striking demonstration of the DPRK's growing intellectual and economic potentials, he added.
					
					 The editorial board of the Internet TV Krasnoe Televidenie posted an article titled "We extend congratulations to the people of the DPRK on its successful putting a satellite into its orbit!"
					
					 Lyudmila Abzeyeva, writer belonging to the Russian Union of Writers, in her congratulatory letter said: I congratulate the friends of the DPRK on their successful launch of a satellite. This is a distinguished success of the DPRK which conjures up good memories of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, outstanding leaders of the DPRK. This reconfirmed the existing line to build socialism on the principle of Juche.
					
					 Kiril Sborov, chairman of the Arkhangelsk Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy of Russia, noted in a statement that the launch of the satellite is the most exciting event which conjures up deep memory of Kim Jong Il who devoted his all to turning the DPRK into a modern space power.
					
					 The Russian newspaper Nezabisimaya Gazetta on December 13 carried an article titled "The Juche idea has reached space".
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The DPRK launched a rocket with a satellite atop on December 12.
					
					 Not a few countries urged the cancellation of the plan for the launch but the DPRK refused to change its line.
					
					 The DPRK remains unfazed by the pressure of the international community which regards the launch of a rocket as a technological test for manufacturing a ballistic missile. Moreover, the DPRK in its answer given by a spokesman for its Foreign Ministry on December 12 declared that it would continue to exercise its legitimate right to launch satellites, no matter what others may say.
					
					 Konstantin Asmolov, senior researcher at the Institute for Far Eastern Studies of the Russian Academy of Sciences, in an interview with the newspaper said that the Korean people demonstrated that they have strength.

articles.title: Int'l Community Recognizes DPRK's Successful Satellite Launch
articles.content:
Int'l Community Recognizes DPRK's Successful Satellite Launch 
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The international community was stunned by the news of the successful launch of the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 in the DPRK, a great event for Songun Korea.
					 The Chinese newspaper People's Daily said the DPRK launched the satellite on Wednesday all of a sudden and announced that it succeeded in putting the satellite into its orbit. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 As a sovereign state the DPRK has not given up its right to launch satellites. That is why there is no need to be surprised by its sudden launch of the satellite in particular. 
					
					 Such rapid and significant adjustment of the DPRK's satellite launch was no means a self-willed action.
					
					 The DPRK has some sensibility toward the pressure of the international community and judged in advance the consequences to be entailed. When the warship "Cheonan" sinking incident and Yonphyong Island shelling case occurred in 2010 the international community thought the situation went to the brink of war. But the situation on the Korean Peninsula was not beyond control. 
					
					 This time, too, the situation on the peninsula will not be out of control. 
					
					 An associate researcher at the China Institute of International Studies said that the DPRK leads south Korea in the space field. At a time when south Korea postponed the launch of satellite Naro the DPRK successfully launched its satellite to prove that its social system is advantageous and south Korea is not in a position to solve such high technological problems, the associate researcher added. 
					
					 The defense minister of Japan at a press conference referred to the DPRK's satellite launch. He showed understanding that certainly the DPRK made overall progress not only in the technology for launch but in the technology regarding the main body. 
					
					 Personages of different social standings in the U.S. were stunned by the successful launch of the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 in the DPRK.
					
					 A former official of the U.S. State Department said that the DPRK demonstrated the steadfast will to fully carry out the behests of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, through the satellite launch in the run-up to the first anniversary of his demise. 
					
					 The North American Aerospace Defense Command made public a statement shortly after the satellite launch in the DPRK, saying that the DPRK successfully launched Unha-3 rocket and it looked successful in putting an object into space, according to the results of observation system's pursuit. 
					
					 An American space expert said north Korea has succeeded in putting a satellite into space. Jonathan McDowell of the Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics said that the Unha-3 rocket launched early Wednesday morning delivered the satellite into orbit and it was a perfect success for north Korea.
					
					 An analyzer of the Land Institute of the U.S., national defense and security research body, said that it was something surprising in the aspect of time control and showed that they are master hands at assembling of missile. 
					
					 A vice-director of Stanford University of the U.S. said that the DPRK has channeled efforts into the development of nuclear and rocket technology to build a thriving nation.

articles.title: DPRK's Successful Satellite Launch Lauded
articles.content:
DPRK's Successful Satellite Launch Lauded
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, made public a statement on Dec. 12, congratulating the DPRK on its successful launch of the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3.
					 "I heard through radio and TV the news that the DPRK successfully launched the satellite," he said.
					
					 Availing himself of this opportunity, he extended sincere congratulations to the dear respected Kim Jong Un and the Korean people.
					
					 "The DPRK fully proved the achievements made in space science and technology," he added.
					
					 He expressed hope that the DPRK would manufacture more satellites for the security and well-being of the people under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Chongryon Central Standing Committee
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Chongryon Central Standing Committee
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a letter from the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) on Wednesday as regards the successful launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3.
					 The letter said that the successful launch of the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 is the firework of the great victory of Songun Korea that has entered the new 100 year history of Juche era.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The complete success of satellite launch is a national jubilee for the DPRK, political and ideological power, military giant and satellite launch country bequeathed down by the great Generalissimos. It has demonstrated its possession of the latest space science and technology to the world again and the great feat that can be achieved only by Marshal Kim Jong Un, another illustrious commander of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The world was deeply impressed by the brilliant strategy and matchless courage of Kim Jong Un, who made sure that miracles were wrought in building an economic power and satellite was successfully launched by the efforts and with the technology of the DPRK upholding the behests of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Reactionary forces including the U.S., Japan and south Korea are raising a hue and cry over the successful satellite launch in the DPRK and its inexhaustible scientific and technological might.
					
					 The Koreans in Japan, bearing in their mind the firm belief that victory is always in store for them as they are led by Kim Jong Un, would dynamically advance the movement of the Koreans in Japan along the road of Juche, patriotism and prosperity, upholding the noble behests of the great Generalissimos as their immortal banner, the letter concluded.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Factories in Pyongyang
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Factories in Pyongyang
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim made field survey of various factories in Pyongyang.
					 He encouraged the workers in a high-pitched drive for the increased production to successfully decorate this significant year with high pride of having demonstrated to the world the might of great Paektusan nation through the successful launch of the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3.
					
					 He looked round various production processes of the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory before convening a consultative meeting.
					
					 The meeting took measures for keeping equipment in full capacity operation by properly managing equipment and technology so as to increase the production of confectionary, and ensuring satisfactory supply of raw and other materials and electricity by relevant units.
					
					 He dropped in at the Pyongyang Electrical Appliances Joint-Venture Company, Pyongyang Metal Building-materials Factory and the Pyongyang Trolley Bus Factory and held consultative meetings.
					
					 They discussed the issue of increasing the generation of electricity and saving it, the issue of pushing ahead with the modernization of the factories and producing various kinds of more goods including convenient household articles suited to the people's taste and the issue of increasing the production of new-type trolley buses.
					
					 Earlier, he went round the Ryuwon Footwear Factory.
					
					 Measures were taken on the spot for producing more quality shoes favored by the people.

articles.title: Greetings to Namibian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Namibian Prime Minister
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim sent a message of greeting to Hage Geingob upon his appointment as prime minister of the Republic of Namibia on December 12.
					 Choe in the message wished him success in his work, expressing his conviction that the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in line with the common interests and aspiration of the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a congratulatory message to Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah on his appointment as foreign minister of Namibia on the same day.

articles.title: Congratulations to Dutch Prime Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Dutch Prime Minister 
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim on Dec. 10 sent a congratulatory message to Mark Rutte upon his stay in office as prime minister of Netherlands.
					 He in the message wished the prime minister success in his work, expressing his conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow strong.
					
					 Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a similar message to Frans Timmermans upon his appointment as foreign minister of Netherlands on the same day.

articles.title: Message to Kim Jong Un from Chairman of Mongolian People's Party
articles.content:
Message to Kim Jong Un from Chairman of Mongolian People's Party
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message from the chairman of the Mongolian People's Party on Dec. 3.
					 The message said that the leadership of the Mongolian People's Party and its chairman paid high respects to leader Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the WPK and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, in deep reverence on the occasion of the first anniversary of his demise.
					
					 It expressed firm belief that the efforts of Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people, for the development of friendly relations between the two countries will be steadily carried forward in the future, too.

articles.title: CPRK Spokesman Denounces Clan of Park Geun Hye for Hurting Supreme Leadership of DPRK
articles.content:
CPRK Spokesman Denounces Clan of Park Geun Hye for Hurting Supreme Leadership of DPRK 
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) Friday released a statement in denunciation of the clan of Park Geun Hye of south Korea for hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. The clan is now locked in "presidential election" campaign with bloodshot eyes but also went busy insulting the sacred Kumsusan Palace of the Sun where the fathers of the nation lie in state. 
					 The "Saenuri Party" seriously insulted the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and incited confrontation, the spokesman said, adding that for this the DPRK warned of the possible grave consequences and advised it to correct the confrontation stand. 
					
					 The spokesman went on:
					
					 Nevertheless, far from exercising restraint, Park and the "Saenuri Party" kicked up confrontation racket more frantically and went so impudent as to hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. 
					
					 All facts prove that the "Saenuri Party" is a group of heinous confrontation maniacs little different from the Lee Myung Bak regime and that Park Geun Hye's talk about "evolution of north policy", "confidence-building" and "dialogue" are just tricks to deceive the public and win more winning votes. 
					
					 Park is now malignantly slinging mud at the successful launch of the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3 and making much ado about "provocation" and "sanctions" together with traitor Lee Myung Bak. She is also making such vituperation as "desperate efforts for interfering in the election". 
					
					 Far from congratulating the DPRK on its successful satellite launch, a great jubilee of the nation in its 5 000 year-long history, she took the lead in the anti-DPRK racket that was kicked up by the hostile forces and let loose a spate of rubbish, while deliberately connecting the satellite launch with the "presidential election" in south Korea.  
					
					 This goes to clearly prove that she harbors grudge against the DPRK and is intent on kicking up hysteria for confrontation.
					
					 It is clear what will happen to the inter-Korean relations if she takes power. 
					
					 She is making desperate efforts to get more winning votes but that will make her position more vulnerable and will not help her in holding power. She should clearly know this.
					
					 The army and the people of the DPRK would deal a sledge-hammer blow at those who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK even a bit.
					
					 She is well advised to clearly understand how the world turns out and behave with discretion.

articles.title: Families Related to Anti-Japanese Armed Struggle Arrive
articles.content:
Families Related to Anti-Japanese Armed Struggle Arrive
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A family of Zhang Weihua, Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, families of So Sun Ok and Li Zade, China-resident Korean anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters, family of Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Baozhong, and family of Chai Shiying, who are Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, family of Son Won Thae, overseas Korean related to revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, arrived in Pyongyang on Friday to take part in a memorial service for marking the first anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.
					 Earlier, a family of Kim Sun Ok related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle in China, and a family of Hu Zhenyi, Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, arrived here.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il from Mongolian President
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il from Mongolian President
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj sent a floral basket to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on the occasion of the first anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.
					 The floral basket was laid before the statues on Friday.

articles.title: Floral Basket Sent to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il by Russian Organization
articles.content:
Floral Basket Sent to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il by Russian Organization
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Lenin Young Communist League of the Russian Federation sent a floral basket to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on the occasion of the first anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.
					 The floral basket was laid before the statues on Friday.

articles.title: Members of Missions of Int'l Organizations Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Members of Missions of Int'l Organizations Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Members of the missions of the UNDP, UNICEF, UNFAO, WHO and WFP here visited the statues of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Friday to mark the first anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il. 
					 They laid floral baskets before the statues and made a bow in humble reverence for the peerlessly great men. 
					
					 The charge d'affaires ad interim of the Egyptian embassy here also visited the statues of the Generalissimos to pay tribute on the same day.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Pay Floral Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Pay Floral Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il 
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the International United Confederation of Koreans Friday visited the statues of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on the occasion of the first anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il. 
					 The delegation laid a floral basket before the statues and paid tribute to them in humblest reverence.
					
					 The delegation led by Kim Chil Song, first vice-chairman of the confederation, arrived here Friday.

articles.title: Mosaics of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Erected
articles.content:
Mosaics of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Erected
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Mosaics portraying smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il "The great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung will always be with us" and "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will always be with us" were erected in Songrim City and Ongjin, Anak, Paechon, Thaethan, Unchon, Sangwon and Sungho counties.
					 The peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu gave field guidance to Songrim City and the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex, clearly indicating orientation and ways for developing the work in all fields in the city and increasing the iron and steel production.
					
					 Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who provided ceaseless field guidance, regarding believing in people as in Heaven, visited Ongjin County several times to lead it with good care so that it might be turned into a socialist land of bliss.
					
					 They also provided field guidance to Anak and Paechon counties, giving meticulous instructions to increase the agricultural production and improve the people's living standard and showing deep benevolence for their people.
					
					 Thaethan and Unchon counties are associated with the warm loving care of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. They traveled steep mountain ranges despite bitter cold to choose a site for building a reservoir and made sure that a bridge was built for school children of a mountain village.
					
					 Officials and other working people in Sangwon and Sungho counties displayed their loyalty in the project for erecting mosaics depicting smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il with a single desire to glorify forever the immortal exploits of the peerlessly great men who devoted their all to the prosperity of the country and happiness of its people.
					
					 Portraits of the smiling peerlessly great men and a mosaic were erected in Songhwa County. The mosaic depicted their images of climbing Mt. Paektu, the holy mountain of the revolution, and visualizing a bright future of thriving Korea.
					
					 Working people and coal miners in Unsan and Hwadae counties, the Toksong Coal Mine and the Sochang Youth Coal Mine erected the mosaic "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will always be with us" with strong yearning for him.
					
					 Mosaics depicting kind-hearted Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il "The great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung providing field guidance to the Pyongyang Elevator Factory" and "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il watching a horizontal arm tower crane after visiting the Pyongyang Elevator Factory" were erected at the factory.

articles.title: Stamps Issued to Commemorate First Death Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Stamps Issued to Commemorate First Death Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK State Stamp Bureau issued stamps (two sheets) to commemorate the 1st anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il, Dec. 17.
					 Seen on the upper part of the stamps are letters reading "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will always be with us".
					
					 One of the sheets contains a picture of the leader enjoying the sunrise on Piro Peak of Mt. Kumgang, as well as words and score of the song "The General Will Live Forever as the Sun". 
					
					 Another sheet displays a picture of the leader giving field guidance to the Huichon Ryonha General Machine Factory.
					
					 The stamps remind people of the admirable revolutionary career and feats of Kim Jong Il, who devoted all his life to the wellbeing of the people and the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Art Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
Art Exhibition Opens 
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- An art exhibition "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will always be with us" opened with due ceremony at the Korean Art Gallery on Friday to mark the first anniversary of his demise. 
					 On display at the venue are more than 60 art pieces showing the undying feats of Kim Jong Il and his noble traits. 
					
					 The art pieces reflect the ardent yearning and boundless reverence for Kim Jong Il and loyalty of all the service personnel and people who are determined to hold him in high esteem forever. 
					
					 Korean painting "Great inheritance of Songun revolutionary leadership", oil painting "Visiting soldiers on the forefront", acryl painting "Personally weathering through the dangerous path of the forefront" and other pieces show the undying feats of Kim Jong Il who victoriously led the struggle for defending socialism and turned the DPRK into a political and ideological power, military power and a country that launched satellites. 
					
					 Among them are pieces depicting the image of Kim Jong Il, who worked heart and soul for prosperity and reunification of the country and people's happiness. 
					
					 Other pieces reflect the strong will of all the service personnel and people of the DPRK to be faithful to the leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, in his opening address said the art exhibition will offer an opportunity for glorifying long the immortal exploits performed by Generalissimo Kim Jong Il for the country and revolution and inspiring the army and people of the DPRK in the effort for building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Always Finding Himself among People
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Always Finding Himself among People
						
Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- It was on December 15 last year that leader Kim Jong Il visited the Kwangbok Area Supermarket in Mangyongdae District, Pyongyang, two days before his demise.
					 The supermarket was built in October 1991 as a department store and later was renovated under the initiative and care of the leader.
					
					 The visit to it ready to start its operation was his last field guidance for the people's wellbeing.
					
					  Recalling the day, Kim Yong Ok, manager of the supermarket, told KCNA:
					
					 "Going round the supermarket for hours despite his bad health, he learned about variety, shape and color of goods and their prices and utility value. He even took such things as frying-pan and bag in his hands, saying with pleasure that the people would like them.
					
					  Then he expressed his satisfaction over the supermarket and its goods helpful to the people's wellbeing and set forth tasks facing the supermarket in its service.
					
					 Touched by his warm love for the people, the employees of the supermarket turned out to implement his behests. Over the past one year we have worked hard to considerably increase varieties of goods and spruce up the supermarket building for customers' convenience. The supermarket generally serves at least 10 000 customers a day.
					
					 We will strive to be a genuine servant for the people, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il."

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Noble Personality (10)
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Noble Personality (10)
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- It is a story about Raul Garcia Alvarez, who was active in Pyongyang as a correspondent of Cuba's Prensa Latina News Agency, and his wife.
					 His wife had had no child for eight years since marriage because of her habitual abortion.
					
					 It was a few months before they were scheduled to return home that she was pregnant again and got hospitalized at the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital.
					
					 Upon hearing the fact, leader Kim Jong Il instructed the hospital to take all conceivable steps for her easy childbirth and saw to it that the government provided them with the same living conditions as before until they left the DPRK.
					
					 At last, she gave birth to a baby in the hospital months later.
					
					 So pleased, the couple sent a letter of thanks to Kim Jong Il, requesting him to name his son. The request represented their will to entirely entrust their family's destiny to him.
					
					 Kim Jong Il named their son Saebyol (morning star) and sent gifts to him, wishing he would be a symbol of friendship forged between the DPRK and Cuba.
					
					 Alvarez said Kim Jong Il's care for his family was also an expression of his friendly feelings towards the Cuban people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il, Peerlessly Great Man (5)
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il, Peerlessly Great Man (5)
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il in his lifetime believed in the popular masses as in Heaven, regarding them as his teacher.
					 "The people are my God" -- this was his motto all his life. It was his view of life and principle to devotedly work for the people.
					
					 He always found himself among the people, making ceaseless guidance tours of different establishments across the country day and night, regardless of weather conditions.
					
					 In 2009 alone, he visited more than 200 entities in the country with a view to improving the people's livelihood.
					
					 He considered it to be his happiness to work heart and soul for the people's wellbeing. He saw to it that everything was made in a way to serve the people above anything else. In a word, all his activities were for the interests of the people
					
					 His motto based on the idea of "The people are my God" was fully embodied in his philosophical ideas and the Korean socialist system centered on the popular masses, displaying great vitality.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Korean Resident in U.S.
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Korean Resident in U.S. 
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Koreans in the U.S. on Dec. 8 posted on its internet website an article titled "Feats left by Chairman of National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il" contributed by Kim Hyon Hwan, director of the Institute of Independent Ideology in the U.S., on the occasion of the first anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.
					 The most distinguished in the undying noble feats leader Kim Jong Il performed all his life are the ideological and theoretical ones indicative of his extraordinary wisdom and energetic ideological and theoretical activities which will shine long in history, the article said.
					
					 He also performed great feats for the country and the nation by leading the revolution and construction with superhuman energy and boundless dedication with the noble mission and responsibility as the leader of revolution, it noted, adding:
					
					 Kim Jong Il, possessed of revolutionary obligation and morality as natural disposition, set a genuine example in realizing the cause of perpetuating the memory of the leader unprecedented in the history of human politics and thus made sure that the august name of President Kim Il Sung and his undying revolutionary career and noble feats shed their rays forever together with the eternal history of Juche Korea.
					
					 He, out of the strong will to realize the behests of the President for national reunification all his life, provided the historic north-south summits and saw to it that the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration were adopted during the days when he led all the fellow countrymen to achieve independence, peace and great national unity and thus opened up the June 15 era of independent reunification in which the noble idea of "By our nation itself" is applied.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, firm defender of socialism and independence, raised the international position and authority of the DPRK and made great contributions to accomplishing the human cause of independence through his energetic external activities for achieving the victory of the socialist cause, building a new independent world, realizing the world peace and stability and strengthening friendship and solidarity with the world people under the uplifted banner of independence against imperialism.
					
					 His noblest feat is that he perfectly settled the issue of succession of leadership.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Keeping June 15 Era of Reunification Alive
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Keeping June 15 Era of Reunification Alive
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Friday calls for radically improving the inter-Korean relations and keeping the June 15 era of reunification alive.
					 This call is made by the paper in a bylined article.
					
					 The June 15 era of reunification was ushered in as leader Kim Jong Il provided a historic Pyongyang meeting which culminated in the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The publication of the June 15 joint declaration marked a national jubilee which gave all Koreans new conviction and hope for the country's reunification and a great event which provided a landmark occasion in the reunification movement.
					
					 The June 15 era of reunification developed the movement for the country's reunification into a nation-wide movement and a mass movement involving people from all walks of life irrespective of ideology, political view and party affiliation. 
					
					 Various organizations and personages in the north, the south and abroad held reunification events common to the nation in Pyongyang, Mt. Kumgang, Seoul, Inchon, etc. on such important occasions as June 15 and August 15, powerfully demonstrating the Koreans' will for reunification 
					
					 The era brought about an epochal advance in the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 Since the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration the north and the south had brisk exchange in the field of sports and artistes in the north and the south staged reunification concerts including joint performance and joint concert.
					
					 Airways and sea routes were opened between the north and the south and roads and railways that had remained cut for decades were reconnected to bring about a dreamlike reality.  
					
					 Tour of Mt. Kumgang gained in scope with each passing day.
					
					 Kim Jong Il provided another round of the north-south summit which resulted in the adoption of a declaration for the development of the inter-Korean relations, peace and prosperity.
					
					 The article calls on the compatriots in the north, the south and abroad to get united close under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration and turn out in the patriotic struggle to improve the inter-Korean relations and pave a wide venue for peace and reunification.

articles.title: Judgment of S. Korean Conservative Regime Urged
articles.content:
Judgment of S. Korean Conservative Regime Urged
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The People's Strength for Building New World of south Korea made up of at least 40 civic and social organizations held a rally at the plaza of the Seoul City Office on December 8 to call for judging the conservative regime.
					 Present there were more than 3 000 people of various circles including workers, farmers, the poor and evacuees.
					
					 Speakers at the rally said that they cannot repress anger at the moves geared for winning in the upcoming "presidential" election which are totally indifferent to the people's living.
					
					 The candidates for the "presidential election" are calling for economic democratization, etc. but the rhetoric about the workers' prosperity is just nonsensical if there is no resolution of the lay-off and part-time job system, they charged.
					
					 They referred to the fact that the workers suffering from the lay-off and part-time job, residents in Kangjong village, Jeju Island, those who were forced to evacuate due to redevelopment and others waged sit-in strike.
					
					 Stressing the need to change the world by the united struggle of the people of various circles, they called for defeating the "Saenuri Party" and bringing about a new world of the people through the replacement of the regime.
					
					 They declared that they would struggle for implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, ensuring the provision of regular jobs to the part-time workers, totally remodifying the "labor law", checking the privatization of the public sectors, getting the registration fee halved, stopping the creation of the north wind, breaking down military alliance with the U.S. and Japan and abolishing the "Security Law".

articles.title: 40th Anniversary of Japan-Korea Association Marked
articles.content:
40th Anniversary of Japan-Korea Association Marked
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place in Tokyo on Nov. 26 to mark the 40th anniversary of the Japan-Korea Cultural Interchange Association. 
					 Present at the meeting were those concerned of the field of arts in Japan including the association, officials of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and other Korean persons of the field of culture and arts in Japan. 
					
					 The meeting heard a congratulatory message from the Korean Society for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries. Then followed speeches. 
					
					 Deputy Chief Director Tokuji Yanagisawa and Director Ui Takagi of the association, and Vice-Chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee Nam Sung U said the association has made a positive contribution to cultural interchange between Japan and the DPRK over the last four decades. 
					
					 They expressed concern over the fact that Japan-Korea cultural interchange has been totally derailed owing to the Japanese government's hostile policy toward the DPRK. The cultural and art exchange between the two countries should never be hindered for political reasons, they held. 
					
					 They expressed expectation that the relations between the two countries will improve, saying that the meeting would be a new starting point for the association and a significant occasion in boosting Japan-Korea cultural interchange. 
					
					 A performance was given by artistes of the Kumgangsan Opera Troupe of Chongryon and Japanese artistes before a reception.

articles.title: 30th National Meeting of Movement for Supporting Korea's Reunification Held in Japan
articles.content:
30th National Meeting of Movement for Supporting Korea's Reunification Held in Japan 
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The 30th national meeting of the movement for supporting the Korea's reunification took place in Gunma Prefecture, Japan on Nov. 25.
					 Present there were Chairman Fumihiro Himori and members of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, Chairman Kiichi Tsunoda and members of the Executive Committee of the National Meeting and representatives of friendly organizations in different parts of Japan.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Vice-Chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan Nam Sung U and officials of Chongryon.
					
					 A message of greeting sent by the Korean Society for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries was read out at the meeting.
					
					 The general secretary of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea said in his keynote report that the U.S., Japan and south Korea, which have stepped up their hostile policy toward the DPRK this year, have staged ceaseless military drills, creating the danger of a war on the Korean Peninsula from the outset of the year.
					
					 The U.S. is the arch criminal escalating the military tension on the peninsula, he said, adding:
					
					 A peace treaty should be concluded between the DPRK and the U.S. and the U.S. forces present in south Korea be withdrawn with the lapse of six decades since the conclusion of the Armistice Agreement as an occasion. The Korean war should thus be brought to a definite end.
					
					 He called for resolutely foiling the red herring of the Japanese government aimed to float the story about "threat from the north" and slander the DPRK.
					
					 The Japanese authorities' stand of regarding the "abduction issue" as more important than the normalization of the Japan-DPRK relations is violation of the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration, he said, adding that the government should immediately lift the sanctions against the DPRK and opt for coming out to talks for normalizing the relations.
					
					 He denounced the Japanese authorities for their human rights abuses against the Koreans in Japan and unconditionally apply tuition-waiver program to the Korean schools.
					
					 Then, speeches on the theme of "Establishment of Peace in Northeast Asia" were made at the meeting.
					
					 The meeting adopted an appeal calling for the pullout of the U.S. forces from south Korea and diverse solidarity activities for the conclusion of a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provided Eternal Foundation for Prosperity of Country: Choe Un Bok
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provided Eternal Foundation for Prosperity of Country: Choe Un Bok
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Choe Un Bok, chairwoman of the General Association of Koreans in China, on Friday said that she will believe in and follow only the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, symbol of the victory and glory of Korea of the sun, and carry forward the tradition of patriotism under his leadership.
					 Choe is visiting the homeland to participate in the memorial service for marking the first anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 She told KCNA she warmly hailed the successful launch of the second version of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3, a landmark event of historic significance in the development of space science and technology of the country.
					
					 She went on:
					
					 The successful satellite launch is the victory that demonstrated to the world the might of the great Paektusan nation.
					
					 At this emotional moment, I could hardly repress admiration at the whole life of matchless patriot Kim Jong Il full of patriotic devotion, who provided the eternal foundation for the prosperity of the country.
					
					 We keenly felt what a great deal he meant to us during the mourning days of December last year when people grieved over his death as a great loss to the nation with bitter sorrow and grief.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, who always found pleasure in the people's happiness, made the forced march of field guidance till the last moments of his life.
					
					 He was the incarnation of patriotism who devoted his all to the country and the people.
					
					 The feats performed by him will shine long along with Songun Korea.
					
					 Greatest patriotism is to uphold the leadership of Kim Jong Un with loyalty, true to the last instructions of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We, overseas compatriots, have cherished the boundless reverence for Kim Jong Un, who is glorifying the dignity of the country with his matchless courage, pluck and original leadership.
					
					 He is wisely leading the people in the homeland all out for carrying out the last instructions of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Revolutionary Activities Reported by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Revolutionary Activities Reported by Foreign Media
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers and internet website reported the dear respected Kim Jong Un's revolutionary activities, illustrated with his photos.
					 The Mexican newspaper Unidad Nacional on November 30 carried news that Kim Jong Un is looking round the Ryugyong Health Complex, People's Open-air Ice Rink and the Skate Park nearing completion and the newly built Breast Cancer Research Centre at the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital.
					
					 The Russian newspaper Patriot No. 45 said that Kim Jong Un inspected the training ground of a horse riding company under Unit 534 of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The paper also carried photos of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Nepali newspaper Weekly Mirror, the Uruguayan newspaper La Juventud and internet website of the Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK on December 7 reported that Kim Jong Un sent a letter to scientists and officials of the Academy of Social Sciences greeting its 60th anniversary.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings took place in Russia, Pakistan, the Czech Republic and Spain between November 23 and December 3 on the occasion of the first anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Speakers including the chief editor of the Russian paper Patriot referred to the sacred revolutionary career of Kim Jong Il and expressed conviction that the DPRK will shed its rays as a thriving country envied by the world as it is led by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Personages of Pakistan in their report and speeches lauded the feats Kim Jong Il performed for the Korean revolution and the world revolution, praising him for consolidating the DPRK as an impregnable socialist fortress by pursuing the Songun politics.
					
					 The chairperson of the Kutna Hora County Committee of the Communist Party of Czech and Moravia sincerely wished the Korean people success in the efforts to implement the behests of Kim Jong Il under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chief of the Catalonia Branch of the Communist Party of the People of Spain evinced the resolution to fully support the just struggle of the Korean people to build a thriving nation and achieve national reunification.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Marked by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Marked by Foreign Papers
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Papers of various countries carried special write-ups on the occasion of the first anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The Nepali paper Janmabhumi on Dec. 1 featured an article contributed by a political commentator under the title "In memory of leader Kim Jong Il". It carried his photo.
					
					 The article said: Events for remembering him are being held in many countries in the run-up to the anniversary of his demise. It is an expression of the boundless reverence of humankind always remembering the great man who performed great exploits by dedicating all his life.
					
					 Saying he was a beacon of hope and a savior of the oppressed popular masses in the world, the article noted thanks to his Songun politics the DPRK could demonstrate its might as an independent state which the imperialists dare not provoke.
					
					 The Ethiopian paper Daily Monitor on Dec. 5 in an article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il is always alive" praised his ideo-theoretical feats and leadership exploits. It also carried a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Indonesian paper Suara Karya on Dec. 5 carried an article titled "Undying contributions performed for the cause of global independence".
					
					 The article introduced energetic external activities of Kim Jong Il. The exploits he performed for the cause of global independence will be immortal together with progressive mankind, it stressed.

articles.title: National Meeting for Remembering Kim Jong Il Held in Peru
articles.content:
National Meeting for Remembering Kim Jong Il Held in Peru
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A national meeting for remembering leader Kim Jong Il took place in Lima, Peru on the occasion of the first anniversary of his demise.
					 Roberto Carbonel Peso, president of the Peru-Korea Friendship Institute for the Study of Juche Songun Policy, praised Kim Jong Il as the great leader of the Korean people and the world people as he devoted his all to the Korean revolution and the cause of global independence since he was born in Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Toward the end of the last century when socialism was frustrated in the East European nations and the country was hard pressed for everything due to consecutive years of natural disasters, he unfolded a new chapter of the Songun politics with a resolute decision, protecting the dignity and sovereignty of the country and the nation and the cause of socialism, Roberto Carbonel Peso added.
					
					 Teresa Otiniano, chairperson of the Peruvian Association for the Study of Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Jong Suk, said Kim Jong Il put up a unique slogan "Let Us Live Our Own Way!," turning the DPRK into a country strong in independence.
					
					 Tani Baler Lopera, international secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Peru (Red Motherland), said the cause of building a thriving socialist nation and achieving national reunification, lifetime desire of Kim Jong Il, is being invariably carried forward under the Songun leadership of Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The secretary general of the Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism who is also chairperson of the committee for remembering Kim Jong Il said Kim Jong Il's devotion to revolution and people, spirit of defending the country and socialism and spirit of struggling against imperialism are all examples to be followed by the revolutionaries of the world.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Different Countries
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- One year has passed since leader Kim Jong Il passed away.
					 In this period there took place more than 10 000 events of various forms in at least 190 countries and at international and regional organizations on such significant occasions as the 70th anniversary of birth of Kim Jong Il, the 100th day of his demise, the 15th anniversary of his election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 21st anniversary of his assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Mourning ceremonies were solemnly held in different parts of the world irrespective of ideology, political view, nationality and religious faith.
					
					 A lot of dignitaries and personages in different countries sent more than 3 000 condolatory messages to the DPRK and paid condolence visits to the DPRK missions in their countries. Among them were heads of party, state and government of more than 120 countries including China, Russia, Cuba, Syria, Cambodia, Nepal, Ethiopia, Nicaragua and Mexico and figures of international and regional organizations, groups for the study of the Juche idea and organizations for friendship and solidarity.
					
					 More than 4 100 wreaths and floral baskets were laid before the bier of Kim Jong Il and portraits of the smiling leader and his portraits at Kim Il Sung Square and DPRK missions in foreign countries.
					
					 Mourning period was declared and flags were hoisted at half-mast in different countries. Flags were also hoisted at half-mast at buildings of UN including the UN Headquarters and the UN Office in Geneva.
					
					 Participants of the plenary meeting of the 66th UN General Assembly, the meeting of officers of the UNFAO and the opening ceremony of the 28th "Golden Circus" International Circus Festival held in Rome paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Committees for mourning the demise of Kim Jong Il were formed in different countries and regional organizations and memorial services, meetings and ceremonies took place in a solemn atmosphere.
					
					 There were brisk activities for eternally glorifying the idea and cause of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The International Kim Il Sung Foundation was enlarged and reorganized into the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation.
					
					 Kim Jong Il received "Nepalese International Peace Prize" from the Nepal Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics, the title of honorary chairman from Soekarno Foundation for Education of Indonesia and the title of honorary citizenship from Caluma City in Bolivar Province and Cuenca City in Azuay Province of Ecuador and Gusau City in Zamfara State and Damaturu City in Yobe State of Nigeria.
					
					 The will to more deeply study and embody the revolutionary ideas of the peerlessly great men was clearly reflected by newly formed and named groups for the study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in many countries including Italy, Bulgaria, Nigeria, South Africa, Mexico, Venezuela and Japan.
					
					 The first Day of Shining Star was celebrated with splendor as the greatest auspicious holiday.
					
					 In response to the call of the American regional preparatory committee for marking the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, preparatory committees formed in more than 40 countries and regions organized colorful events to introduce the immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il and his noble virtue and wise leadership and gave wide publicity to them in media.
					
					 There took place an international internet seminar under the headline "The great leader Kim Jong Il will always be with us" under the co-sponsorship of the international preparatory committee for celebrating the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung and the Korean Friendship Association.
					
					 Officials of political parties, governments, organizations and bodies in different countries and international and regional organizations and personages of different social standings visited the DPRK missions in their countries and laid floral baskets before portraits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and full-length paintings of the peerlessly great men to pay highest tribute to them. The missions also received floral baskets and bouquets representing the best wishes for their immortality.
					
					  Political parties, organizations and personages of different social standings of foreign countries presented gifts to Kim Jong Il, the great sun, praying for his immortality. They included the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries and China-Korea Friendship Association, the State Academic Igor Moiseyev Dance Company of Russia, the Party of Socialist Unity Centre (Communist) of India, the delegation of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand, the Brazilian Center for Peace and Solidarity among Peoples, the coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico and the director general of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea.
					
					 The international festival marking the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung and the World Conference on the Juche Idea were held in Pyongyang with splendor, Kimjongilia shows took place in different countries and a joint photo exhibition in New York.
					
					 Top prize was awarded to Kimjongilia, an immortal flower, at the 2012 Netherlands Benro World Horticutural Expo and the 2012 Dalian Autumn Chrysanthemum Show in China. 
					
					 A series of poems and songs were created and published. Among them were "Great Son of Korea", "Broad Smile", "Rays of Love" and "We Pledge, Looking to the Sky above the DPRK in December" reflecting the people's boundless reverence and yearning for Kim Jong Il.
					
					 More than 15 000 media carried portraits of smiling Kim Jong Il and photos on his revolutionary activities and gave wide publicity to his sacred life and immortal exploits.
					
					 Media in different parts of the world vied with each other in reporting the exciting news that the army and people of the DPRK held Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal leader of the party and state.
					
					 Dozens of countries reported the full text or gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Hold Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as General Secretary of Our Party Forever and Successfully Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche" in little over one month since the work was brought out.
					
					 Media in different countries gave wide publicity to the sacred revolutionary life of Kim Jong Il and his undying feats and noble personality under the headlines "Great Man Kim Jong Il", "Lodestar Will Shine Forever", "Legacy of Leader Kim Jong Il", etc.

articles.title: Poems for Remembering Kim Jong Il Created by Foreigners
articles.content:
Poems for Remembering Kim Jong Il Created by Foreigners
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Personages of different countries created poems and words of songs revering leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Vietnamese poet Nguyen Sy Thiet in a poem "In remembrance of the great General" said that Kim Jong Il defended the dignity of the nation and socialism with Songun politics, noting that all people will always venerate and remember the gifted great man of the world who loved to wear simple jumper.
					
					 A member of the Korean Friendship Association in a poem "Son of nation" said that Kim Jong Il lived for the people all his life, believing in them as in Heaven.
					
					 He built a powerful country, while standing firm against the enemies with his iron will, the poem said, stressing that he is the eternal son of the nation who lives in the hearts of the nation.
					
					 Takashi Nada, representative of the Ehime Institute for Contemporary Korean Issue in Japan, in a poem "I swear to the sky over Korea in December" expressed his will to live as a solider of Kim Jong Il forever despite the moves of imperialists and reactionary hack writers.
					
					 He pledged to fly the red flag in the land of Korea by opening the gate to a thriving nation together with the Korean friends.
					
					 Noboru Kameda, representative of the Society of the Japan-Korea Culture, in the words of a song "Rays of love" praised Kim Jong Il as the sun, adding its rays represent eternal love and peace.

articles.title: Committees for Remembering Kim Jong Il Formed Abroad
articles.content:
Committees for Remembering Kim Jong Il Formed Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Committees for remembering leader Kim Jong Il were formed in foreign countries and regions.
					 The committees have been formed in at least 60 countries and regions including Nepal, Mongolia, India, Iran, Tajikistan, UK, France, Italy, Denmark, Switzerland, Nigeria, South Africa, Democratic Congo, Uganda, Brazil, Ecuador and Mexico since the appearance of the committee in Peru on October 17.
					
					 In Russia committees for remembering him were organized in Nakhodka, Khabarovsk Territory and Blagobeshensk as well as Moscow.
					
					 The committees for cherishing the memory of the peerlessly great man were also formed in regional and international organizations. They include the African Regional Committee of Friendship and Solidarity with the Korean People and the Korean Friendship Association.
					
					 Deep reverence for him pervaded the venues of inaugural ceremonies which were significantly held in the presence of prominent figures of governments, political parties and organizations and representatives of regional and international organizations.
					
					 Diverse events for remembering him are being held around the world like seminar on his feats, remembrance meeting, lecture, photo and book exhibition and film show sponsored by the committees organized in those countries.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un observa curso de lanzamiento de "Kwangmyongsong-3"
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un observa curso de lanzamiento de "Kwangmyongsong-3"
						
Pyongyang, 14 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dio a las 8 de la manana del dia 12 al Comite de Tecnologias Espaciales de Corea (CTEC) la orden escrita final de lanzar la unidad no.2 del satelite artificial de la Tierra "Kwangmyongsong-3".
					A las 9 de la manana, una hora antes de lanzamiento, el Mariscal visito el Centro de Control General de Satelites.
					
					Luego de averiguar el estado de preparacion, dio la orden y observo atentamente todo el curso de lanzamiento.
					
					Muy satisfecho de que los cientificos y tecnicos hayan lanzado exitosamente el satelite artificial, evaluo altamente sus meritos y les expreso agradecimiento en nombre del CC del PTC.
					
					La unidad no.2 del satelite cientifico-tecnico "Kwangmyongsong-3" fue desarrollada y fabricada con las fuerzas, las tecnologias y las inteligencias totalmente nuestras, dijo y agrego complacido que la puesta exacta del satelite en la orbita polar consolido la posicion del pais como potencia en cosmografia y demostro que la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea llego a la cima de ciencias y tecnicas sofisticadas del mundo.
